question: 201. For which of the following is AWS not responsible for security?
202. For which of the following are you not responsible for security?
203. Which of the following is not included in the well-architected framework’s definition of security?
204. Which of the following is a principle of the well-architected framework’s security section?
options: A. Encrypt the least amount of data possible.
B. Always encrypt the most important data.

question: 205. Which of the following are principles of the well-architected framework’s security section? (Choose two.)
options: C. Encrypt data in groups rather than individually.
D. Encrypt data at the destination.

question: 206. Who is responsible for encrypting data in the cloud?
options: D. AWS provides an API, but you are responsible for security when using that API.
C. AWS provides mechanisms such as key rotation for which they are responsible, but you are responsible for appropriate usage of those mechanisms.
answers: C. AWS provides mechanisms such as key rotation for which they are responsible, but you are responsible for appropriate usage of those mechanisms.

question: 207. What is the term used to represent the resiliency of data stored in S3?
208. Which of these statements is not true?
options: D. Customers move data between regions rather than AWS.
C. AWS will initiate moving data between regions if needed.
A. AWS recommends encrypting data at rest and in transit.
B. AWS will never move data between regions unless initiated by the customer.
answers: C. AWS will initiate moving data between regions if needed.

question: 209. Which of the following can be part of a strategy to avoid accidental data overwriting of S3 data?
210. Which of the following should always be done to protect your AWS environment? (Choose two.)
options: B. Enable MFA Delete on your S3 buckets.
C. Set a password rotation policy for users.
D. Create custom IAM roles for all users.
A. Enable MFA on the root account.
answers: C. Set a password rotation policy for users.
A. Enable MFA on the root account.

question: 211. At what level does infrastructure protection exist in AWS?
212. Which of the following might be used to detect or identify a security breach in AWS? (Choose two.)
213. Which of the following AWS services is associated with privilege management?
214. Which of the following AWS services is associated with privilege management?
215. Which of the following AWS services is associated with identifying potential security holes?
216. Which of the following is not one of the five pillars in the cloud defined by the AWS wellarchitected framework?
217. Which of the following is not one of the five pillars in the cloud defined by the AWS wellarchitected framework?
218. Which of the following is not one of the security principles recommended by AWS’s wellarchitected framework?
options: D. Protect data in transit and at rest.
C. Apply security at the highest layers.
answers: C. Apply security at the highest layers.

question: 219. Which of the following is one of the security principles recommended by AWS’s wellarchitected framework?
options: D. Keep people away from data.
A. Make sure all users have passwords.
B. Only protect data at rest.
C. Turn on MFA Delete for S3 buckets.
answers: D. Keep people away from data.

question: 220. The AWS’s well-architected framework defines five areas to consider with respect to security. Choose the two that are part of this set. (Choose two.)
